isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - REASSEMBLE - RIGHT REVERSE IDLER GEAR ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If previously removed, thread pipe plug in the rear of the reverse idler shaft and tighten ( Figure 204). Install the thrust washer to the end of the idler shaft.

note.para: If previously removed, replace the needle bearing into the bore of the reverse idler gear.

figure.caption: Figure 204. Thread Pipe Plug in Rear of Reverse Idler Shaft

step1.para: Install the bearing inner race on the idler shaft and insert shaft into the case bore, threaded end of shaft to the front. As the idler shaft is moved forward, install the reverse idler gear on the shaft, long hub to the front and seating on the bearing inner race. Position the thrust washer on the shaft between the gear and support boss in the case and continue with movement of the idler shaft forward into the bore of the support boss ( Figure 205).

figure.caption: Figure 205. Install Reverse Idler Gear on Shaft

step1.para: Make sure that the reverse idler shaft is seated in the bore of support boss and forward as far as possible. Install the washer and stop nut on the front of the shaft ( Figure 206). Tighten nut to 50 to 60 ft-lbs. (68 to 81 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 206. Install Washer and Stop Nut on Front of Shaft

step1.para: Install the OUTER RACE of auxiliary countershaft front bearing into the case bore ( Figure 207).

figure.caption: Figure 207. Install Outer Race of Auxiliary Countershaft Front Bearing

important.para: Mark the countershaft drive gear for timing purposes. On the drive gear of each countershaft assembly, mark the tooth aligned with the keyway of the gear and stamped with an "O" for easy identification ( Figure 208). A highly visible color of toolmaker's dye is recommended for making timing marks.

figure.caption: Figure 208. Mark Countershaft Drive Gear For Timing Purposes
